item.description:
Meet us at the Rocky Pond parking lot off Bare Hill Road for a two hour hike. (map above)

Breakfast at Panera Bread at the Shops @ Five at 8:00 if you are able. (Panera is on Long Pond Road in Plymouth near Exit 5)

Federal Pond is a large 129 acre pond with one end sticking into the western edge of Myles Standish State Forest.

According to the EPA, it has been invaded by swollen bladderwort, which wikipedia says are carnivorous plants.

We will attempt to skirt the pond and avoid getting eaten by the carnivorous plants.

(photo from salicicola.com )

Note: We are not botanists, so don't expect any expertise. It just seems like something worth trying to check out.
item.how_to_find_us: The Rocky Pond lot is about 4 miles from forest headquarters. Heading north on Lower College Pond Road for about a mile, bear left on Bare Hill Road and follow north for about 3 miles til you see the lot right after the power lines.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: In Search of the Carnivorous Plants of Federal Pond
